conclusion: Analyze the motion of the ball using projectile motion principles to determine the time of flight from point B to point C.
Point B is directly above point A, so its coordinates are (0, R).
Point C lies on the semicylinder such that OC makes an angle of 53° with the horizontal.
Using trigonometry, the horizontal distance from O to C is R cos(53°) and the vertical distance from O to C is R sin(53°).
The coordinates of point C are (0.45, 0.60).
Set up the equations of motion for the ball thrown horizontally from B with an initial velocity v_0 using projectile motion equations.
Use the horizontal equation x = v_0 t and vertical equation y = R - (1/2) g t^2.
At point C, the coordinates satisfy x = 0.45 and y = 0.60.
Solve for time t using the horizontal motion equation: 0.45 = v_0 t, hence v_0 = 0.45/t.
Substitute v_0 = 0.45/t into the vertical motion equation: 0.60 = 0.75 - 5t^2.
Calculate t = sqrt(0.03), hence t = 0.1732 s.
The time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C is 0.1732 s.
